Ho Chi Minh City said it had
successfully resuscitated a man who was poisoned
after drinking powdered milk mixed at home.
Previously, this patient's mother and younger brother
had died all three of them drinking the
same milk.
powder According to information from Cho Ray Hospital, the
poisoned patient is a
55-year-old man who fell asleep in Tien Giang province at about
6:00 p.m. on October 15. This person was
transferred to Vinh Long General Hospital
in a state of deep coma.  Acute respiratory failure
requiring mechanical ventilation. Questioning medical history
recorded on October 14 and 15. The
patient's family, whose 85-year-old mother and
45-year-old brother died after drinking powdered milk,
arrived on October 15 at his funeral.
The patient's mother and younger brother also used
this type of milk. About an hour after drinking the
milk, the patient fell into diarrhea
with symptoms of vomiting, abdominal pain,
progressive respiratory failure and was transferred to
Vinh Long General Hospital for treatment.
However, because the patient's health
deteriorated, he was transferred to
Cho Ray Hospital.
After 12 hours of emergency treatment, the patient's health
changed positively. Tests
showed liver and kidney damage.  The heart muscle is
stable now. The patient is fully awake.
However, the cause of the poisoning has
not yet been determined
related to this incident. Yesterday, the
